content: Hello! I’m your AI guide for building a doodle caption. I’m designed to ask you questions and guide your reasoning but if you want to take control of your own creative process, I’ll be happy to help wherever possible.
what is this image
This is a droodle—a simple abstract drawing. Take a close look and see what you can discover. What parts of this image stand out to you most?
The dots
What do those dots remind you of? Maybe they bring an image or scene to mind.
They remind me of ants
Ants are intriguing! Maybe there's a story about them near that square. What do you think those ants could be up to?
They could be going to get the cracker

That's an interesting scenario! Let’s relate this to the droodle. I can see that the idea of ants going for a cracker strongly relates to the dots moving toward the square. How does this connection fit into our story?
I don't know
I'm sensing that you’re having trouble with this, so I’m going to have a go. How about: "Ants having a square meal." What do you think? Feel free to adjust it!
Ok
Great! The caption "Ants having a square meal" ties in humor and a literal interpretation of the shapes. How do you feel about this caption? Does it capture the essence of the droodle for you?
I am not sure because there are two squares
Ah, I see! With two squares, perhaps we can build on the idea further. What if the ants are comparing which square meal they should go for? Do you have any thoughts on how to develop this?
Not sure, maybe the ants are on a table
Maybe the table is part of their adventure, choosing between two square meals on the tabletop. How would this scene play out in a story?
Ants square up against cracker
I like it! "Ants square up against cracker" adds a fun twist and fits the imagery. How do you feel about this new caption? Does it capture the idea you had in mind?
Yes
That's fantastic! "Ants square up against cracker" fits the droodle perfectly. It's creative and playful. If you have any more ideas or want to try another one, let me know!
